2.lts: Translated by Samson Wanyonyi Ngosia and Tobias Walubengo

4.eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
4.lts: Sibeleho buchwa esindu SILALA sia okhoyela omanye khuli ebirusi bia korona

13.eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.
13.lts: Wasinjila sinaho ninaye. Sinaho sia ofulenje fubili silakhingilila amame okhutuukha wa oli.

17.eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
17.lts: Kho niiba mbo olengela omundu wulolekha ni alakhololanga/ alasimulanga/ naho omulwale onyala:

18.eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby
18.lts: Omuhelesie emasiki okhukhinga emunwa nende amolu. Anyala wakhololelamo naho wasimulilamo mani siakhingilila buli omundu wuli ahambi okhunyoola ebirusi.

22.eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
22.lts: Aundi sali omulwale ta, alekhinganga buchwa.

23.eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
23.lts: Abandu balala bahambisibwa yilali sibechesianga mbo abalwale ta, nabuchwa banyala bahambia abandi obulwale.

24.eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
24.lts: Khandi bubeele obulayi okhulekha okhutubaana nende abandu mu ebituma, sikila somanya wina wunyala okhuba omulwale ta.

32.eng: & even on the outside of your face mask
32.lts: Yakhaba elwanyi wa emasiki ya okhukhinga omunwa na amolu.

33.lts: Olupao lwa khu yingasi ya ekorofa

38.eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
38.lts: Kakhaba kario, ofuse fundi amare ka omundu omulwale kanyala karoonya khu ofundu fundi khuli…

42.eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
42.lts: Olatiila khu ofundu funo mani wichukhane otiile amoni wuwo,

43.eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
43.lts: Kho okhusinga ofundu funo nende esabuni naho amachi nende esikelo sia amalwa niyo yinjila yonyene ya okhurusiakho ebirusi bino.

44.eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
44.lts: Eburusi binyala biekhala khu ofundu khu ofuse ofurambi

47.eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these
47.lts: Niko kakila nibuli obulayi okhulonda amakhuwa ka

48.eng: wash with soap up to here

51.eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
51.lts: Okhehabasia hamoni wuwo ta. (Naho hamoni wa omundu wundi ta.) Niiba mbo okhoya okhole kano, singa emikhono kikio nende esabuni obulayi bwene mbele.

52.eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
52.lts: Ofuse fwolana okwimba “Mwana wa mbeli” khabili

56.eng: wash the back of your hands

58.eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
58.lts: Nikaba bari otililekho, okhahenda ta. Singa buchwa amakhono kaako nende esabuni.

59.eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
59.lts: Nikanyalikha okhatiila olubeka lwa elwanyi lwa emasiki ta.

61.eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
61.lts: Ebirusi bikhulunduanga olubeka lwa mukari lwa emasiki oleboha oluhono.

62.eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
62.lts: Sukuna emasiki ya okhukhinga emunwa yilanyira. Okheboha emasiki okhubira yinyinga ndala ta.

67.lts: Buli omundu abe nende etaulo yiye

68.eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
68.lts: Mukhasanga ofwakhulia khusililikho silala ta,naho ofukombe naho chitaulo ta.

69.eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
69.lts: Sonyala okhutiila hamoni wuwo nende yikhumbo ta ata wakhakhaka.

70.eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
70.lts: Niwikula naho okhwikala olwiki rumikhila yikhumbo naho amabeka nikanyalikha, okharumikhila omukhono ta.

72.eng: and after being out in the public
72.lts: Nende niwakharula elwanyi mu abandu abanyinji

74.eng: Always wash your hands with soap…
74.lts: Singa emikhono kikio buli khase nende esabuni….

80.eng: Read the articles for more tips!
80.lts: Read the articles for more tips!

81.eng: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
81.lts: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020).

82.eng: "The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
82.lts: "The Wunah Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report (Jan 25, 2020)

83.eng: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020
83.lts: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosental, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020)

85.eng:
Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVI 019 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-1O
Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
﻿For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com
85.lts:
Additional notes: Chinjila cha okhwikhinga okhunyoola Korona chino chinyala charumikha okhwikhinga okhunyoola obulwale bundi khuli esifundesana nende esikhololo, kho kenyekhana okhuchilonda ata yakhaba obulwale nibukhaliwo ta.
References: lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references.  https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here: https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: 1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing. 2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project 3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com

bookText.eng:
About Coronavirus



There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
SPREADS
Mouth
Nose
Eyes
Get into your
Healthy Person
Sick Person
The virus spreads when ﻿these droplets
Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.
1
2m-0.5m
Achoo!
So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby
2
Thank you﻿*sniffles*
OR,
Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
chopsticks
Healthy person
Train straps
Lift buttons
Tissues
Cups
Digital devices
& even on the outside of your face mask
Stair bannisters
Mouse
Pens
Door knobs
Their hands
However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
you might all fall sick.
or your loved one's face
rub eyes
And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
soap
precautions
Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here
soap
elbow
Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
under the nails
for 20 seconds
between the fingers
wash the back of your hands
What is thoroughly?
If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
droplets
*Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
Use a serving spoon
Baby
Daddy
Mommy
Everyone gets their own towel
Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
Home
and after being out in the public
Before you eat
Always wash your hands with soap…
And finally,
soap
Stay safe, everyone!
Stay safe, everyone!
soap

bookText.lts:
Olumbe lwa Korona

Translated by Samson Wanyonyi Ngosia and Tobias Walubengo

Sibeleho buchwa esindu SILALA sia okhoyela omanye khuli ebirusi bia korona
BISALANIKHANGA
Naho mu omunwa kukwo
Mu amolu
Mu chimoni
Kenjila
Omundu omulamu
Omundu omulwale
Ebirusi bisalanikhanga lwa amame kano
Wasinjila sinaho ninaye. Sinaho sia ofulenje fubili silakhingilila amame okhutuukha wa oli.
1
2m
Achuu!
Kho niiba mbo olengela omundu wulolekha ni alakhololanga/ alasimulanga/ naho omulwale onyala:
Omuhelesie emasiki okhukhinga emunwa nende amolu. Anyala wakhololelamo naho wasimulilamo mani siakhingilila buli omundu wuli ahambi okhunyoola ebirusi.
2
Orioo muno *Amolu kalekalanga*
NAHO
Aundi sali omulwale ta, alekhinganga buchwa.
Abandu balala bahambisibwa yilali sibechesianga mbo abalwale ta, nabuchwa banyala bahambia abandi obulwale.
Khandi bubeele obulayi okhulekha okhutubaana nende abandu mu ebituma, sikila somanya wina wunyala okhuba omulwale ta.
Chisaala cha yinyama
Omundu omulamu
Ofwitililo mu omutuka
Bia okhumina muchilifuti
Chikaratasi cha okhwiyeya amamila
Ofukombe
Ofundu fwa tekinolochi
Yakhaba elwanyi wa emasiki ya okhukhinga omunwa na amolu.
Olupao lwa khu yingasi ya ekorofa
emausi ya ekombiuta
Chikalamu
Omukhono kwa olwiki
Amakhono kaabo
Kakhaba kario, ofuse fundi amare ka omundu omulwale kanyala karoonya khu ofundu fundi khuli…
Enywe munyala mwarachikha okhulwala mwesi.
Naho amoni wa abasiime baabo
Osukue chimoni
Olatiila khu ofundu funo mani wichukhane otiile amoni wuwo,
Kho okhusinga ofundu funo nende esabuni naho amachi nende esikelo sia amalwa niyo yinjila yonyene ya okhurusiakho ebirusi bino.
Eburusi binyala biekhala khu ofundu khu ofuse ofurambi
Esabuni
Okhwikhingilila kano
Niko kakila nibuli obulayi okhulonda amakhuwa ka
Singa nende esabuni okhutuukha hano
Esabuni
Yikhumbo
Okhehabasia hamoni wuwo ta. (Naho hamoni wa omundu wundi ta.) Niiba mbo okhoya okhole kano, singa emikhono kikio nende esabuni obulayi bwene mbele.
Ofuse fwolana okwimba “Mwana wa mbeli” khabili
Mu ofutere
Khu ofuse fwa chisekendi 20
Akarikari wa chinjala
Singa yinyuma wa esikalabo
Obulayi bwene nisio sina?
Nikaba bari otililekho, okhahenda ta. Singa buchwa amakhono kaako nende esabuni.
Nikanyalikha okhatiila olubeka lwa elwanyi lwa emasiki ta.
Amame
Ebirusi bikhulunduanga olubeka lwa mukari lwa emasiki oleboha oluhono.
Sukuna emasiki ya okhukhinga emunwa yilanyira. Okheboha emasiki okhubira yinyinga ndala ta.
Rumikhila esichiko sia okhukabula
Omwana
Tata
Maayi
Buli omundu abe nende etaulo yiye
Mukhasanga ofwakhulia khusililikho silala ta,naho ofukombe naho chitaulo ta.
Sonyala okhutiila hamoni wuwo nende yikhumbo ta ata wakhakhaka.
Niwikula naho okhwikala olwiki rumikhila yikhumbo naho amabeka nikanyalikha, okharumikhila omukhono ta.
Yingo
Nende niwakharula elwanyi mu abandu abanyinji
Nosiili okhulia
Singa emikhono kikio buli khase nende esabuni….
Okhumalilisia
Esabuni
Buli omundu yilinda!
Buli omundu yilinda!
Esabuni
Read the articles for more tips!
"This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020).
"The Wunah Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report (Jan 25, 2020)
"How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosental, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020)
Main references for medical info:
Additional notes: Chinjila cha okhwikhinga okhunyoola Korona chino chinyala charumikha okhwikhinga okhunyoola obulwale bundi khuli esifundesana nende esikhololo, kho kenyekhana okhuchilonda ata yakhaba obulwale nibukhaliwo ta.
References: lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references.  https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
